intro: Liabum herrerae, commonly known as the Herrera's liabum, is a flowering plant native to the Andean regions of South America. It belongs to the Malvaceae family, which includes hibiscus and cotton plants. The plant is characterized by its simple, alternate leaves and showy, trumpet-shaped flowers that range in color from white to pink. It typically grows in moist, shaded environments and is adapted to high-altitude conditions. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a rare and potentially endangered species.
